intro: Osteospermum thodei, commonly known as the blue osteospermum, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features showy blue to purple ray florets surrounding a central disk of yellow tubular flowers. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and prefers well-drained soil and full sun. Osteospermum thodei is popular in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in Mediterranean climates.
